page.title: 03HOUSING IN HARROW
page.content: THIS PART OF THE LONDON BOROUGH OF HARROW IS ESSENTIALLY A RESIDENTIAL AREA. POPULATION IS DECLINING WITH SMALLER HOUSEHOLDS BEING THE NORM AND AN INCREASING PROPORTION OF HOUSEHOLDS OVER PENSIONABLE AGE. THE PREDOMINANT HOUSING TENURE IS OWNER-OCCUPATION. THE TYPE OF HOUSING REFLECTS THE HISTORICAL GROWTH OF THE SUBURB. THE OLDEST DWELLINGS TEND TO BE COTTAGES, TOGETHER WITH LARGER HOUSES ON THE HILL WHICH HAVE SPREAD OUTWARD FROM THE RAIL STATIONS. BY 1939 THE "TUDORBETHAN" SEMI WAS EVERYWHERE WITH SOME INTER-WAR TERRACED HOUSING. PRESENT TRENDS INCLUDE THE BUILDING OF LUXURY FLATS AND DETACHED NEO-GEORGIAN HOUSES ALL REFLECTING THE PLEASANT BUT EXPENSIVE HARROW ENVIRONMENT.
